body:
> org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.remote.selector.HashCodeSelector.select(HashCodeSelector.java:32) ~[server-core-6.0.0-GA.jar:6.0.0-GA] at 

From here, I am assuming your cluster management is not working well.
This is a simple ElasticSearch exception, `ElasticsearchStatusException`.
You clear the elasticsearch, but your agent hasn't restarted.
You are using the annotation in the wrong scenario. This annotation works for a new thread and run scenario.
thanks

I add webappService.sh
-Duser.timezone=UTC

eval exec "\"$_RUNJAVA\" ${JAVA_OPTS} -jar ${JAR_PATH}/skywalking-webapp.jar \
         --spring.config.location=${JAR_PATH}/webapp.yml \
         --logging.file=${LOG_FILE_LOCATION} \
	 -Duser.timezone=UTC \
        2>${WEBAPP_LOG_DIR}/webapp-console.log 1> /dev/null &"
but not change UI default timezone.

> You are using the annotation in the wrong scenario. This annotation works for a new thread and run scenario.

I use the annotation followed by document
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Application-toolkit-trace-cross-thread.md

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/55204759-2deaef00-520b-11e9-89ff-6a5bc56dbcf6.png)

I add -Duser.timezone=UTC in webappService.sh
but not change UI timezone.
You could choose UI timezone.
UI based on your browser at now.

Before code review, we need your libraries dependencies. And related licenses. Because if exist no compatible license, we can't host it in Apache repo.

We need the whole list, thanks.

> Before code review, we need your libraries dependencies. And related licenses. Because if exist no compatible license, we can't host it in Apache repo.
> 
> We need the whole list, thanks.

This feature depends on alibaba/nacos (https://github.com/alibaba/nacos).

The LICENSE is APL 2.0 (https://github.com/alibaba/nacos/blob/master/LICENSE).

> You are updating submodules, which is not expected.

I have tried, but don't know how to exclude the submodes PR. 

So I created a new PR (https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/2422), and close this one.
I know. But I am asking for dependency library of nacos client.

> This feature depends on alibaba/nacos (https://github.com/alibaba/nacos).

Does `nacos-client` depend on other 3rd-party libs? I assume YES. And what are they?
No. OAL is real. Read our document, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/README.md.
But that example is showing you to create a new thread, rather than use thread pool. Big difference.

> > This feature depends on alibaba/nacos (https://github.com/alibaba/nacos).
> 
> Does `nacos-client` depend on other 3rd-party libs? I assume YES. And what are they?

This is the list of 3rd-party libs depended by nacos-client:
```xml
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>log4j-core</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>log4j-slf4j-impl</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
            <artifactId>nacos-common</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
            <artifactId>nacos-api</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>ch.qos.logback</groupId>
            <artifactId>logback-classic</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>ch.qos.logback</groupId>
            <artifactId>logback-core</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.guava</groupId>
            <artifactId>guava</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <artifactId>commons-codec</artifactId>
            <groupId>commons-codec</groupId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.codehaus.jackson</groupId>
            <artifactId>jackson-mapper-lgpl</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>net.jcip</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcip-annotations</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.github.spotbugs</groupId>
            <artifactId>spotbugs-annotations</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>io.prometheus</groupId>
            <artifactId>simpleclient</artifactId>
            <version>0.5.0</version>
        </dependency>
```
The license info:
| component | license |
| --------------- | --------- |
| slf4j-api |  MIT License |
| junit | EPL 1.0 |
| spotbugs-annotations | LGPL |
| jackson-mapper-lgpl | LGPL 2.1 |
| logback | EPL 1.0 & LGPL 2.1 |

The other compotents license is APL 2.0.

> to creat

I found the cause. It's the limit size(20) when es query segments by traceid if having more then 20 segments.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/55213422-2e48b180-522e-11e9-9461-51f76f9cac14.png)


I adjust the size to 100, then the trace graph is ok.

Anyway, how to set the size may be a quesiton.

The licenses look like good, but what does the `optional` mean? Does the end user need that or not?

The right list would be the jars added in skywalking dist tar. Could you cross check your new dist with skywalking's master dist?
Why do you have so many segments? A batch process? cc @peng-yongsheng What do you think about this?
Wow, It's a cool feature for skywalking cluster.

> The licenses look like good, but what does the `optional` mean? Does the end user need that or not?
> 
> The right list would be the jars added in skywalking dist tar. Could you cross check your new dist with skywalking's master dist?

'optional' means it will not be included in the dist jars.

Yes, a batch process, involves many threads
@caowenyan hi is this https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.asynchttpclient/async-http-client ?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/22494798/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/22494798)

Coverage decreased (-0.02%) to 13.897% when pulling **c039284e59377da97427553bb7c2325628b2be68 on zipkin-trace** into **1fd5c5790a25875f0e10c72fd767eaf38bbd2c99 on master**.
This is new to me. Maybe we need open this as config item.

@wu-sheng This is the first issue he found, and should not be the only one. One by one invoke or less batch invoke is conformity with the orginal design. But too many batch asynchronous threads is ignored.

What do you mean about original design? I am a little confused. 

I think tracing a batch task is not a very common use case, but at the trace data level, they are well organized. Right now, the impact is we can't query all of them in before.
We are not discuss about **batch asynchronous threads**, we just discussed how to support **asynchronous threads**, right?

> We are not discuss about batch asynchronous threads, we just discussed how to support asynchronous threads, right?

I don't intend to start any discussion. I am just asking, if a trace has more than 20 segments, then what we should do in query. Do we provide config to make query available?

I think asynchronous is another complex topic.

> > We are not discuss about batch asynchronous threads, we just discussed how to support asynchronous threads, right?
> 
> I don't intend to start any discussion. I am just asking, if a trace has more than 20 segments, then what we should do in query. Do we provide config to make query available?
> 
> I think asynchronous is another complex topic.

Agree with you, we don't known what the limit size is suitable, add a config item to support this first. 
I just notice that there will be other issues.

> Agree with you, we don't known what the limit size is suitable, add a config item to support this first.
I just notice that there will be other issues.

Yes. I noticed those too :) So could you send a PR to fix those? I think we need some mechanism to make them consistently.

> > Agree with you, we don't known what the limit size is suitable, add a config item to support this first.
> > I just notice that there will be other issues.
> 
> Yes. I noticed those too :) So could you send a PR to fix those? I think we need some mechanism to make them consistently.

OK
@peng-yongsheng Thanks. I will leave this as an issue to you.

Command to run `agent`
> docker run \
  --rm \
  -p5775:5775/udp \
  -p6831:6831/udp \
  -p6832:6832/udp \
  -p5778:5778/tcp \
  jaegertracing/jaeger-agent:1.11 \
  --reporter.grpc.host-port=host.docker.internal:14250
Trace gen is built in my local env.  Ref https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/tree/master/internal/tracegen
Ref #2044 Pure trace mode added.
Right now, SkyWalking backend supports traces from Zipkin and Jaeger, saved in their native formats, providing query capabilities from SkyWalking UI.

I resolve this problem when I rebuild my oap-server... -.-

But now I get another problem, es, oap and ui are all in CST timezone like 'Tue, 02 Apr 2019 14:05:37 +0800' while I use the command 'date -R'.

If I choose UTC on UI, trace will appear. And if I use Asia/shanghai, I need select the range earlier than 8h.
Then your server still run in utc time. Not +8
English only, please. Which cluster management do you use? If k8s, then, do you have API server access right?

User wall updated.
____

Trace formats are supported, I would expect to support analysis in the short term. Because no particular committer or contributor wants to work on this.

As, I will remove the milestone and label as `TBD`.
This is supported in RocketBot UI. We will have this automatically after the project donation finished.

We passed the community vote and Incubator vote. We are waiting for the ASF board final resolution.

I think we could close this discussion for now. Thank you all for supporting the project, and welcome everyone in the community.

I the correct use of 00 - rbac. Yml, but I use the namespace is the default, the other is to operate according to the document (https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-kubernetes).

The reference configuration k8s rules here (https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/advanced-deployment.md) 

Any questions about where the configuration is hereWhere is this configured
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16507478/55450162-d250a500-5600-11e9-864f-0e3f799b97ce.png)
If you want to understand the mode, you need to understand how skywalking cluster runs. The config we provided is only for `Mixed` mode.
@litian33 Could you try to use the latest Nacos release to submit a new PR and list the new dependencies there?

Also, in this kind of pull request, we don't limit how many test cases you provide. Even one new test case, which could effectively test one more line, it will be acceptable. Just try your best to make tests more sense.
Thx. I resolved it

First of all, we are not competing with Pinpoint. We have our own landscape and design goals, read [Concepts and Designs](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/README.md). We have users in different languages and different scenarios(including tracing, APM and service mesh observability).

So, please, if you want to know something, just ask the question, don't involve pinpoint thing in, which could cause unnecessary discussion.

If you want to trace more methods, read [optional plugins](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#optional-plugins), at least the following three will help you, especially the last one is super powerful to enhance codes without plugin development.
- Trace Spring annotation beans
- Gson serialization lib in optional plugin folder
- Customize enhance Trace methods based on description files, rather than write plugin or change source codes.

We have new APIs for async scenarios now.
Most configurations will downstream from OAP backend. So, right now, don't need more discussions.
This is WIP now. So I will shut down this issue.
